story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. **Given** the project is new, **When** the `npx create-next-app@latest ibe160-app --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app` command is executed, **Then** a new Next.js project is successfully created with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, ESLint, and the App Router. 2. **Given** the Next.js project is created, **Then** its directory structure aligns with the "Project Structure" guidelines specified in `architecture.md` (e.g., `app/`, `components/`, `lib/`, `styles/`, `public/`, `prisma/`, `tests/` directories are present or can be created as needed).

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: First implementation story should execute: `npx create-next-app@latest ibe160-app --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app` This establishes the base architecture with these decisions: Next.js framework, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, ESLint, App Router, and default Next.js build tooling.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: The project structure is defined with `app/`, `components/`, `lib/`, `styles/`, `public/`, `prisma/`, and `tests/` directories.

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The application will be built using the Next.js App Router, leveraging Server-Side Rendering (SSR) and Server Components for optimal performance and a modern development experience.

doc.title: Epics
doc.snippet: As a developer, I want to initialize the project with the correct structure and dependencies, so that I can start building the application.

constraints.constraint: The project must be initialized with Next.js (App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and ESLint.
The directory structure must align with `architecture.md`.
Adhere to the project structure defined in `architecture.md`.
`lib/` for utilities, types, and API client logic.

tests.standards: The testing strategy involves Unit Tests (`Jest`, `React Testing Library`), Integration Tests (API routes, database interactions), and End-to-End (E2E) Tests (`Playwright`, `Cypress`). Initial setup should confirm the basic test environment.

ideas.idea: Verify that the `npx create-next-app` command runs successfully and that the generated `package.json` contains the correct dependencies.
Write a test to check for the existence of the directories and files specified in the project structure.
